history.content:
CS70 is typically webcast (with no clickers or anything), which will probably continue next semester (at the very least, I haven't heard anything from Professor Rao that would suggest otherwise).

As for enrolling in a discussion for another class, that should be fine as far as 70 is concerned.  However, do keep in mind that you'll have to fill out the SIS form to override the conflict.  Which can take a month or more to be processed, because yay for calcentral.  (In previous semesters you've been able to speed up this process by having the department override the conflict--instructions for how to do this for CS courses haven't been posted yet, but based on how it's worked previously, it will probably be similar to the process for EE classes outlined in @5173)

Is CS70 next semester webcasted? And if so, is there clicker participation or is it just webcasted? If it is just webcasted, are we allowed to enroll in a discussion for another class that conflicts with the actual lecture time?
history.subject: CS70 Webcast

history.content: Is CS70 next semester webcasted? And if so, is there clicker participation or is it just webcasted?
history.subject: CS70 Webcast
